org.apache.hama.bsp.message

Class HamaMessageManagerImpl<M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hama.bsp.message.AbstractMessageManager<M>
      • org.apache.hama.bsp.message.HamaMessageManagerImpl<M>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable, HamaMessageManager<M>, MessageManager<M>, HamaRPCProtocolVersion, VersionedProtocol

    public final class HamaMessageManagerImpl<M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>
extends AbstractMessageManager<M>
implements HamaMessageManager<M>
    Implementation of the HamaMessageManager.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public final void init(TaskAttemptID attemptId,
        BSPPeer<?,?,?,?,M> peer,
        HamaConfiguration conf,
        InetSocketAddress peerAddress)
        Description copied from interface: MessageManager
        Init can be used to start servers and initialize internal state. If you are implementing a subclass, please call the super version of this method. The socket address provided may be used for initializing the server connection. If it is used or not used, the message manager should provide a unique InetSocketAddress that identifies the server for the peer listening on the socket. This socket address should be returned in MessageManager.getListenerAddress()
        Specified by:
        init in interface MessageManager<M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>
        Overrides:
        init in class AbstractMessageManager<M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>

        public final void close()
        Description copied from interface: MessageManager
        Close is called after a task ran. Should be used to cleanup things e.G. stop a server.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        addr - socket address to which BSP Peer Connection will be established
